content.description:
Fun moves on positive holds. If only this were longer. 

  Follow left-trending weakness to under the top chimney, then a bigger move to grab the bottom of the chimney. Next instead of climbing in the chimney, step Right onto the face and finish up a crack to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection:
For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Radical Books sector . 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
About eight feet right from the obvious gully at left end of this sector. About four feet right from below an obvious chimney near the top of the wall. 

  --> See on this routes Photo <--

content.description:
Interesting moves. Upper section has some tricky hold. 

  Up the crack to big ledge, then up the face above. 

  Variation: At the big ledge, step Left and finish up the big Right-facing corner (5.6+). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Radical Books sector .

content.location:
Right-facing corner which goes half-way up, below right from a bigger Right-facing corner, and a few feet left from a Left-facing corner which goes half-way up. 

  --> See on this routes Photo <--

content.description:

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.

content.description:
Interesting moves. 

  Up the right side of the wide crack (without using holds on the left side). Then up to matching hands on the obvious horizontal hold 3-5 feet below top of wall.    . . (The next move above is more like 5.10, then the exit up over the top is challenging without positive holds). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Interesting fun moves. 

  Up the left side of wide crack, then into the left-trending arch. Exit the arch crack earlier or later, then straight to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Interesting moves. Some less-positive holds higher up. 

  Up the corner, the a bit left to finish up face to top (without using the crack to the right). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Interesting moves. 

  Up the face to the big ledge, then a bit left and finish up the arete which forms the left edge of the big upper right-facing corner.

content.description:
Sustained thoughtful moves. 

  Up the face to finish through the top of the arch. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.

content.description:
Some thoughtful moves at the difficulty grade. Too bad its not longer. 

  Up the gully, then exit right to the top. 

name: translated as "Brief Lessons" by Rovelli. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.

content.description:
Short climbs (18-25 ft high) on a vertical wall. 

  Comfortable base area. 

  Top-Roping: To get access to the top of this crag, either scramble up around its right (east) end, or perhaps climb the left-most route up the obvious gully. 

warning: The rock on and around this cliff has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
